intro: Taberna disparifolia, commonly known as the variable leaf taberna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. Its leaves are notably variable in shape and size, contributing to its common name. Taberna disparifolia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories.
